t: Psalm 71
Prayer of an Old Man for Deliverance.
In*pn You, O Lord,*s I have taken refuge; Let*ln me never be ashamed.
In*ln Your righteousness deliver me and rescue me; Incline*ln Your ear to me and save me.
Be*ln to me a rock of habitation to which I may continually come; You*ln have given commandment to save me, For*ln You are my rock and my fortress.
Rescue*ln me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, Out*ln of the grasp of the wrongdoer and ruthless man,
For*ln You are my hope; O*ln Lord God,*s You*i are*i my confidence from my youth.
By*ln You I have been sustained from my*i birth; You*ln are He who took me from my mother’s womb; My*ln praise is continually of You.
I*ln have become a marvel to many, For*ln You are my strong refuge.
My*ln mouth is filled with Your praise And*ln with Your glory all day long.
Do*ln not cast me off in the time of old age; Do*ln not forsake me when my strength fails.
For*ln my enemies have spoken against me; And*ln those who watch for my life have consulted together,
Saying,*ln “God has forsaken him; Pursue*ln and seize him, for there is no one to deliver.”
O*ln God, do not be far from me; O*ln my God, hasten to my help!
Let*ln those who are adversaries of my soul be ashamed and*i consumed; Let*ln them be covered with reproach and dishonor, who seek to injure me.
But*ln as for me, I will hope continually, And*ln will praise You yet more and more.
My*ln mouth shall tell of Your righteousness And*iln of Your salvation all day long; For*ln I do not know the sum of*i them.*i
I*ln will come with the mighty deeds of the Lord God;*s I*ln will make mention of Your righteousness, Yours alone.
O*ln God, You have taught me from my youth, And*ln I still declare Your wondrous deeds.
And*ln even when I*i am*i old and gray, O God, do not forsake me, Until*ln I declare Your strength to this*i generation, Your*ln power to all who are to come.
For*ln Your righteousness, O God, reaches*i to the heavens, You*ln who have done great things; O*ln God, who is like You?
You*ln who have shown me many troubles and distresses Will*ln revive me again, And*ln will bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
May*ln You increase my greatness And*ln turn to*i comfort me.
I*ln will also praise You with a harp, Even*iln Your truth, O my God; To*ln You I will sing praises with the lyre, O*ln Holy One of Israel.
My*ln lips will shout for joy when I sing praises to You; And*ln my soul, which You have redeemed.
My*ln tongue also will utter Your righteousness all day long; For*ln they are ashamed, for they are humiliated who seek my hurt.
